1.text: And the LORD said to Moses,

2.text: “Speak to the Israelites and take from them twelve staffs, one from the leader of each tribe. Write each man’s name on his staff,

3.text: and write Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi, because there must be one staff for the head of each tribe.

4.text: Place the staffs in the Tent of Meeting in front of the Testimony, where I meet with you.

5.text: The staff belonging to the man I choose will sprout, and I will rid Myself of the constant grumbling of the Israelites against you.”

6.text: So Moses spoke to the Israelites, and each of their leaders gave him a staff—one for each of the leaders of their tribes, twelve staffs in all. And Aaron’s staff was among them.

7.text: Then Moses placed the staffs before the LORD in the Tent of the Testimony.

8.text: The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Testimony and saw that Aaron’s staff, representing the house of Levi, had sprouted, put forth buds, blossomed, and produced almonds.

9.text: Then Moses brought out all the staffs from the LORD’s presence to all the Israelites. They saw them, and each man took his own staff.

10.text: The LORD said to Moses, “Put Aaron’s staff back in front of the Testimony, to be kept as a sign for the rebellious, so that you may put an end to their grumbling against Me, lest they die.”

11.text: So Moses did as the LORD had commanded him.

12.text: Then the Israelites declared to Moses, “Look, we are perishing! We are lost; we are all lost!

13.text: Anyone who comes near the tabernacle of the LORD will die. Are we all going to perish?”
